Artemis (ii)

Artemis Program

The Artemis program is a robotic and human Moon exploration program.

Artemis is led by NASA & partnered with the European, Canadian & Japanese space agencies.

The program's long-term goal is to establish a permanent base camp on the Moon and facilitate human missions to Mars.

The major components of the program are the Space Launch System rocket, Orion spacecraft, Lunar Gateway space station and the Human Landing System.

Unlike the other program components, the Human Landing System is to be commercially developed by private industries

The contract was awarded to SpaceX in July 2021 for an initial $2.89bn, modified in Nov 2022 by an additional $1.15bn.

SpaceX intends to use a variant of their Starship spacecraft for this purpose.

Artemis will establish a new space station, a suite of new lunar science instruments and technology demonstrations, and establish a long term lunar presence.

The agency will leverage its Artemis experiences and technologies to prepare for the next giant leap â€“ sending astronauts to Mars.

The Artemis program is subdivided into individual missions - read more here.
